curam.util.client.domain.marshal

Class AddressMarshal

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.common.plugin.AbstractPlugIn
      • curam.util.common.domain.AbstractDomainPlugIn
        • curam.util.client.domain.marshal.AbstractDomainMarshal
          • curam.util.client.domain.marshal.AddressMarshal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DomainMarshal, DomainPlugIn, PlugIn

    public class AddressMarshal
extends AbstractDomainMarshal
    A domain marshal for addresses. Addresses contain embedded values that represent the individual elements of the address. These elements may differ depending on the particular address format (e.g., there are different formats for UK and US addresses).

      • assemble

        Returns:

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(java.lang.Object data,
                            Path path)
                     throws MarshalException
        Resolves a path to a value embedded in a value of a complex type of domain. It is not always necessary to provide a complex implementation of this method, as the renderer may perform this work internally. A renderer may perform the parsing or may use an XSLT stylesheet or other means. The data to be used to resolve the path is the object returned from the DomainMarshal.preResolve(String) method.

        This address marshal supports retrieval of values using paths of the following forms:

        • /format - returns the current address format.
        • /header - returns the address header information.
        • /element[element-name] - returns the named element from the address value. The predicate can be the name of any element of the address format defined in the application configuration. For example, /element[CITY], or /element[ZIP]. Each address format can define different named elements, so use the /format path to first retrieve the address format, look up that format information to get the names of the elements, and then request the elements from this marshal by name.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to used when resolving the path.
        path - The path to be resolved. The root of the path is the data itself; it does not include the path steps that select the server interface property.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the value that was resolved.
        Throws:
        MarshalException - If the path cannot be resolved.
